name: Goblu
location: Flying Waters (Flower Fields), Flying Manor, Endless Tower (Stage 3, Trial 3)
description: Goblu is a Boss in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 that has long red hair with three painted masks in the middle. It primarily uses its limbs to attack and perform combos. During the fight, Goblu grows multiple flowers that allow it to generate shields. Goblu is a mandatory Main Story Boss. Some players speculate that Goblu might be Maelle's plushie, as Maelle remarks before the fight that he seems familiar to her, and he shares a visual resemblance to Esquie and Francois. A chromatic variant, 'Chromatic Goblu,' also exists.
tips: Goblu is weak to Lightning Damage - use Gustave's Overcharge or Lune's Thunderfall. Stacking Burn is also effective. Destroy flowers by shooting them (immune to AoE). Blue flowers grant shields, red flowers grant damage buff - prioritize shooting red flowers. For the Jump Attack, parry right as Goblu's butt hits the ground. Reach Level 10 before attempting. Turn off Automatic QTEs for more damage.
rewards: Shape of Health x1, Polished Chroma Catalyst x1, Chroma Catalyst x3, Recoat x1, 1,330 Chroma, XP (2700 XP)

name: Gestral Village
location: The Continent, accessible after leaving Ancient Sanctuary
description: A village inhabited by Gestrals in the overworld area called The Continent. The main objective here is to advance the story by seeking help to cross the sea, which requires obtaining a password from Golgra by winning the Legendary Tournament. Gestral Village has two rest points: the Entrance (found immediately upon entering) and the Gestral Arena (on the opposite end, with a flag to reset skill points using a Recote). Key NPCs include Golgra the chef/leader, Limonsol who runs the tournament, and merchants Jujubree and Eesda.

name: Golgra
description: The village chef and leader of Gestral Village. She confirms that the best bet for crossing the water is Esier, but only the greatest warriors are allowed through, requiring a password obtained by entering the Legendary Tournament. Head straight to the chef's place and talk to her to learn how to find Esqui/Esier. She holds the password needed to progress.

name: Jujubree
description: A merchant in Gestral Village who sells various items including the Critical Moment Picto. Challenge him to a fight to unlock the Demonam weapon for Gustave/Verso. Giving him the Weird Pictos rewards the Augmented Aim Picto. Located in the bazaar area of Gestral Village.

name: Eesda
description: A merchant who ambushes the player in a back alley in the bazaar. Defeating him unlocks his shop, which sells the Healing Mark Picto and the Sikarum weapon for Maelle. Found by exploring the back alleys of Gestral Village's bazaar area.
tips: Be prepared for an ambush when exploring the back alleys.

name: Legendary Tournament
description: A required tournament to obtain the password to visit Esier. Players fight four Legendary Warriors: Bertrand Big Hands, Dominique Giant Feet, Matthieu the Colossus, and Julien Tiny Head. Winning grants a character-specific weapon. The tournament is only accessible after speaking with Golgra. Limonsol is in charge of allowing participation.
tips: If Gustave has learned the Recovery skill, it will be helpful in the 1-on-1 fights. The tournament consists of four consecutive battles against legendary warriors.
requirements: Main Story - Get Password, speak with Golgra first

name: Ono-Puncho Max Damage Challenge
description: Deal 9,999 damage in a single hit to win the Sakapatate outfit for Maelle. Requires significant setup including recruiting Sciel/Steio, equipping Maelle with the Sikarum weapon and the Roulette and Marking Shot Pictos. The Roulette Picto is the secret ingredient, providing a 50% chance for a 200% damage bonus.
tips: Use Sciel/Steio's Fortune Fury skill and Gustave's powerful skill to give Maelle a damage buff. Activate Maelle's Last Chance skill to enter Virtuoso stance for an additional 200% damage buff. The Roulette Picto from the Gestral Gambler in the casino is essential.
requirements: Recruit Sciel/Steio, Sikarum weapon, Roulette Picto, Marking Shot Picto

name: Alexsoundro's Request
description: Help the tall gestro Alexsoundro find his patate, Purumi, on the leaning pillar. This requires running and jumping carefully across wooden catwalks to reach the little gestal/patate. Alexsoundro is a tall gestro in Gestral Village who has lost his patate companion.
tips: Carefully navigate the wooden catwalks on the leaning pillar. Take your time with the platforming sections.

name: Karatom's Blue Mushroom Request
description: Talk to the small purple gestro Keratum (Karatom) who asks the player to find a blue mushroom. The reward for giving him the mushroom and defeating the Ultimate Sakapatate once more is 3 Polished Chroma Catalysts and the Pure Outfit for Gustave. Karatom is a small purple gestro seeking a rare blue mushroom.
tips: Find the blue mushroom first, then return to Karatom. You'll need to defeat the Ultimate Sakapatate again for the full reward.

name: Manor Kitchen Basement Secret
description: Find the area with a sign near the stage merchant, turn back, and enter the door to the manor kitchen. Interact with three specific objects - the statue, a pen, and the candle holder - to open a secret door to the basement. A hidden basement in the manor kitchen containing valuable items.
tips: Look for the sign near the stage merchant (Alexcyclo). The three objects to interact with are: statue, pen, and candle holder. Interact with all three to reveal the secret door.
rewards: Shape of Energy, Haircut for Maelle

name: Wake Victorifo (Sleeping Gestral)
description: A sleeping gestral near his home can be woken by shooting the mirror in his room. Once awake, the player can enter his house to grab Chroma and defeat him for money/exp. Victorifo is a gestral who sleeps deeply near his home in Gestral Village.
tips: Shoot the mirror in his room to wake him up. Then enter his house to collect the Chroma and optionally fight him.
